prompt: Create a case report about a patient with COVID-19. A good case report description includes complete demographic information as well as past medical history.
response:
Patient Case Report: COVID-19

Demographic Information:  
Age: 67  
Sex: Male  
Race: White  

Past Medical History:  
- Hypertension (diagnosed 10 years ago, well-controlled with lisinopril)  
- Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus (diagnosed 8 years ago, on metformin)  
- Hyperlipidemia  
- Former smoker (20 pack-years, quit 5 years ago)  
- No known history of chronic lung disease  
- No immunosuppressive conditions  
- Received annual influenza vaccination, not yet vaccinated for COVID-19 at time of presentation  

Case Description:  
A 67-year-old White male presented to the emergency department in March 2023 with a 5-day history of fever, nonproductive cough, fatigue, and increasing shortness of breath. He reported mild myalgias and loss of taste. He denied chest pain, palpitations, or gastrointestinal symptoms. He had been exposed to a family member who recently tested positive for COVID-19.

On examination, his temperature was 38.2°C, heart rate 96 bpm, blood pressure 134/82 mmHg, respiratory rate 22 breaths/min, and oxygen saturation 91% on room air. Lungs were notable for bilateral crackles at the bases. Laboratory evaluation revealed lymphopenia and mildly elevated C-reactive protein. Chest X-ray demonstrated bilateral patchy infiltrates.

A nasopharyngeal swab tested positive for SARS-CoV-2 by RT-PCR. The patient was admitted for supplemental oxygen and monitoring. He received supportive care, dexamethasone, and remdesivir per hospital protocol. His hospital course was complicated by mild hypoxemia requiring nasal cannula oxygen for three days. He was discharged after 7 days in stable condition with instructions for home isolation and follow-up.
